name: MOA-2007-BLG-192L
scenarioDescription:
The MOA-2007-BLG-192L Exoplanetary System

MOA-2007-BLG-192L is a star with 0.06 times the mass of the Sun, and null times its radius. It is located 3261.56 light years away from the solar system.

MOA-2007-BLG-192L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

MOA-2007-BLG-192L b

MOA-2007-BLG-192L b was discovered by the MOA observatory using the microlensing method. Its discovery was announced in 2008-09. Its semi-major axis is 0.62 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit.

The mass of MOA-2007-BLG-192L b is 3.18 times the mass of Earth. At 3.18 Earth masses, MOA-2007-BLG-192L b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system MOA-2007-BLG-192L, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by MOA.
